name: Hewlett, Walter B.
employer: Center for Computer Assisted Research in the Humanities (CCARH)
title: Director and Co-founder
ngos: William and Flora Hewlett Foundation (board member since 1966, chair 1994-2014); Hewlett-Packard board of directors (1987-2002); Agilent Technologies board of directors (1999-2002)
notes: Son of HP co-founder William Hewlett. Born June 23, 1944. Ph.D. in Music from Stanford University (1980). Adjunct professor at Stanford Department of Music. Founded CCARH in 1984. Led shareholder opposition to the 2002 HP-Compaq merger, calling it a '$25 billion mistake'. Independent software developer and digital musicologist.

name: Ikehara, James M.
employer: Silicon Valley Pediatric Dentistry and Orthodontics
title: Dentist (DDS)
notes: Born in Honolulu, Hawaii; raised in San Jose. Graduate of Bellarmine College Preparatory and UC Davis. DDS from University of the Pacific, San Francisco. Pediatric dental specialty certificate from Children's Memorial Hospital, Chicago. Took over practice in 1995 in San Jose, CA.

name: Jacobson, David
title: Vice Chairman (retired 2024)
political_donations: Bundled $50,000-$100,000 for Obama 2008 presidential campaign; served as deputy finance chair for Obama 2008
notes: Born October 9, 1951. Graduate of Johns Hopkins University and Georgetown University Law Center. Spent 30 years as commercial litigation attorney at Sonnenschein Nath & Rosenthal in Chicago. Served as U.S. Ambassador to Canada 2009-2013 (appointed by Obama). Received State Department's 2012 Sue M. Cobb Award. Joined BMO Financial Group as Vice Chairman in October 2013.

name: Jagard, Christopher G.
title: Attorney
notes: San Francisco-based attorney (California State Bar #191147). Employment law practice. Member of the California State Bar since 1997.

name: Johnson, Gregory C.
title: Executive Chairman
political_donations: Donated $38,400 to Republican National Committee in 2020 election cycle; contributed to Romney Victory, Ryan-NRCC Victory Committee, NRCC, and NRSC
ngos: San Francisco Giants (Chairman of the Board and Control Person since 2019)
notes: Born 1961/1962. Grandson of Rupert H. Johnson Sr., who founded Franklin Templeton Investments in 1947. B.A. in accounting and business administration from Washington and Lee University. Joined Franklin in 1986. Served as CEO 2004-2021; became Executive Chairman 2021. Became Giants control person November 2019. Family has been part of Giants ownership since 1993.

name: Klyce, Henry
title: Chairman
notes: Born February 5, 1948 in Memphis, Tennessee. B.A. from Cornell University (member of Quill and Dagger society). Serial medical device entrepreneur; co-founded Medical Instrument Development Laboratories (sold to Alcon 1985), founded Surgical Dynamics, co-founded ORRIS (merged to form Alliance Medical Corporation), founded St. Francis Medical Technologies (sold to Kyphon for $525M in 2007), founded Spartek Medical. Inventor on over 70 patents.

name: Lancelle, Jonathan K.
employer: San Francisco Opera Orchestra; San Francisco Ballet Orchestra
title: Associate Principal Double Bass
notes: Professional double bass player. Member of the San Francisco Opera Orchestra since 1979. Also holds position of Assistant Principal Double Bass with the San Francisco Ballet Orchestra.

name: Lasky, Laurence
title: Partner
notes: Ph.D. Founding scientist of Genetics Institute in 1981, one of the earliest biotech companies. Senior scientist at Genentech for 20 years, reaching the title of Genentech Fellow before retiring in 2002. Research focused on cell adhesion molecules, selectins, and glycoproteins. Coauthor on over 135 publications; co-inventor on 37 patents. Partner at US Venture Partners 2008-2014. Joined healthcare VC firm The Column Group in 2014. Also serves as scientific advisor to Synthekine.

name: Lee, Brian
title: Co-founder and Managing Director
ngos: Lowell Milken Institute of Business Law and Policy at UCLA (board member)
notes: Born March 15, 1971 in South Korea; raised in Orange County, California. B.A. in Economics and Business and J.D. from UCLA. Previously attorney at Skadden Arps and manager at Deloitte. Co-founded LegalZoom (2001), ShoeDazzle (2009, with Kim Kardashian), The Honest Company (with Jessica Alba), and Arena Club (2022, with Derek Jeter). Founded BAM Ventures in 2015.

name: Lenczowski, Hubert
title: Attorney (retired)
notes: Business and corporate attorney based in Walnut Creek, California. Admitted to California Bar 1981. M.A. from Columbia University School of International Affairs (1977); J.D. from University of California Hastings College of the Law (1980). Specialized in business sales, M&A, real estate, and estate planning. Received AV Preeminent rating. Also owned Duncan Peak Vineyards in Mendocino County until selling to the Jiang family in 2014. Retired from law practice in 2023.

name: Lenczowski, John
title: Founder, President Emeritus, and Chancellor
ngos: The Institute of World Politics (founder); Ethics and Public Policy Center; American Enterprise Institute; Council for Inter-American Security
notes: Born July 20, 1950 in Hamilton, New York. Son of Professor George Lenczowski of UC Berkeley. B.A. from UC Berkeley; M.A. and Ph.D. from Johns Hopkins University School of Advanced International Studies. Served in U.S. Department of State as Special Advisor to the Under Secretary for Political Affairs (1981-83). Served as Director of European and Soviet Affairs at the National Security Council (1983-87) and principal Soviet affairs advisor to President Reagan. Founded The Institute of World Politics in Washington, D.C. in 1990. Served as President until 2021, then named President Emeritus and Chancellor. Part-time faculty at Georgetown University for 15 years.

name: Levtov, Ilya
title: Co-Founder and CEO
notes: Based in San Francisco, California. B.A. from Columbia University and Juilliard School; MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business. Began career in corporate finance at Goldman Sachs. Held business development roles at Spot Runner and Crunchyroll. Vice President at venture capital fund Venrock before founding Craft.co in 2015, an enterprise supply chain intelligence platform. Co-founded Tobiko Data in 2022, which developed SQLMesh, an open-source data transformation platform. Tobiko Data acquired by Fivetran in September 2025.

name: Mao, Tyson Francis
title: Co-Founder and CEO
ngos: World Cube Association (co-founder 2004; former board member)
notes: Born May 8, 1984. B.S. in Astrophysics from Caltech (2006). Co-founder of the World Cube Association (WCA) in 2004, the governing body for Rubik's Cube competitions. Set world record for 3x3x3 blindfolded event in 2005. Career in high-frequency algorithmic trading, then product management at Google and Zynga. Co-founded Tobiko Data in 2022 with brother Tobias Mao and Iaroslav Zeigerman. Tobiko Data acquired by Fivetran in September 2025.

name: Marchesi, Silvano B.
title: County Counsel (retired)
notes: California attorney (State Bar #42965). Admitted January 9, 1969; University of San Francisco School of Law. Served as Deputy County Counsel for Contra Costa County in the 1980s, then Assistant County Counsel in 1990, and County Counsel from 2001 to 2009. License went inactive in 2011. Resides in Alamo, CA.

name: Nishkian, Levon H.
title: President and Founder
notes: Structural engineer, P.E. B.S. from University of Arizona; civil engineering degree from UC Berkeley. Grandson of Leon Nishkian, a Turkish-Armenian immigrant who founded the original Nishkian engineering firm in San Francisco in 1919. Re-launched Nishkian as an independent firm in 1989 with partner Kevin Menninger. Grew the firm into four offices: Nishkian Menninger (San Francisco), Nishkian Dean (Portland, opened 1999), Nishkian Monks (Bozeman), and Nishkian Chamberlain (Los Angeles, opened 2007).

name: Percy, Roger D.
title: Principal
ngos: Alliance for Education, Seattle (Emeritus Board member)
notes: Founder of R.D. Percy & Company, which developed television viewer measurement and reaction technology in the 1980s-1990s. Multiple patents for systems determining television viewing habits and viewer reactions to broadcasts. Previously served as President and CEO of R.D. Percy & Company (1976-1989). Founded Avenace Incorporated in 2009 (audience measurement of physical places). Based in the Seattle, WA area.

name: Pressler, Larry L.
title: Founder and Chairman
notes: Born March 29, 1942 in South Dakota. Rhodes Scholar (St. Edmund Hall, Oxford). M.P.A. from Harvard Kennedy School (1966); J.D. from Harvard Law School (1971). Vietnam War veteran (U.S. Army, 1966-1968). Served in U.S. House of Representatives (1975-1979) and U.S. Senate (1979-1997) as a Republican from South Dakota. Sponsored the Pressler Amendment restricting military aid to Pakistan. Primary sponsor of Telecommunications Act of 1996. Ran as independent Senate candidate in 2014. Founded The Pressler Group, LLC, a business consulting and government relations firm, in 1997. Recipient of two lifetime Fulbright teaching awards; taught at over 20 universities including Harvard and Oxford.

name: Richards, Peter C.
employer: Peter C. Richards, A Prof Corp
title: Attorney
notes: California attorney (State Bar #102541). Admitted April 27, 1982. Temple University School of Law. Practices taxation, trusts and estates in Woodland Hills, CA.

name: Swindells, William R.
title: Chairman of the Board, President, and CEO (retired)
political_donations: Donated $1,000 to Moshofsky for Congress (1981); $500 to Bob Smith for Congress (1981); $500 to National Forest Products Association Political Committee (1981); $1,000 to Zupancic for Congress (2003)
ngos: Willamette University Board of Trustees (1971-2001, chair 1987-1995); Oregon Community Foundation (board); Oregon Health and Sciences University Foundation (board); Oregon Historical Society (board); Oregon Wildlife Heritage Foundation (board); World Forestry Center (board)
notes: Born September 16, 1930 in Oakland, California; died November 7, 2018 in Portland, Oregon at age 88. Great-grandson of George Gerlinger, founder of Willamette Valley Lumber Company (1906). B.S. in industrial engineering from Stanford University (1953). Served in the Air Force. Joined Willamette Industries and became CEO and Chairman in 1984. Led company through period of tremendous growth including Fortune 500 status. Retired in 1995 when Steven Rogel became CEO. Company was acquired by Weyerhaeuser in a hostile takeover in 2002. Gave generously to the University of Oregon.
